name: ORDER_SENSITIVITY
description: The ORDER_SENSITIVITY table contains information on the sensitivity of orders placed in clinical system.

columns.name: ORDER_PROC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the procedure order record.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number of the sensitivity data recorded within each procedure record.

columns.name: ORD_DATE_REAL
columns.description: This is a numeric representation of the date each order was placed in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date the order was placed. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple orders on one day.

columns.name: ORD_END_DATE_REAL
columns.description: This is a numeric representation of the end date for each order in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date the order was placed. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple orders on one day.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: RESULT_DATE
columns.description: The date the technician ran the tests for each order

columns.name: ORGANISM_ID
columns.description: The ID of the organism that was cultured and tested for susceptibility.

columns.name: ORGANISM_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the organism.

columns.name: ANTIBIOTIC_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value of each antibiotic that was tested on each organism culture.

columns.name: SUSCEPT_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value associated with the susceptibility of the organism culture to the antibiotic. These correspond to standard HL7 susceptibilities: 1-Resistant, 2-Moderately sensitive, 3-Intermediate, and so on.

columns.name: SENSITIVITY_VALUE
columns.description: This item is not populated by the EMR. It may be populated with the sensitivity value from an interface.

columns.name: LAB_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value associated with the status of each result, such as 1-In Progress, 2-Preliminary, 3-Final, 4-Edited.

columns.name: SENS_ORGANISM_SID
columns.description: This item will hold the sub ids for each organism helping the application to create a unique data structure for the display of microbiology results.  The unique data structure will use this item in conjunction with organism name or id as one of the key subscripts thus preventing errors with the display.   E.g. Salmonella typhi (Strain Ty2) and Salmonella typhi (Strain CT18) may have the same name (Salmonella typhi) but will have different sub ids depending on the external system sending the data. In order to display both of the above, a unique sub id is required.

columns.name: SENS_COM_ORG_RES_ID
columns.description: This item stores the RES (Results master file) record id which stores comments related to the organisms.  The item is related to the organisms stored in item ORD 2220 and the line number of this item will match directly to the organism line number.

columns.name: SENS_OBS_INST_TM
columns.description: Timestamp to track per micro result component when it was collected/observed.

columns.name: SENS_ANL_INST_TM
columns.description: Timestamp to track per micro result component when it was analyzed in lab.

columns.name: SENS_START_LN
columns.description: This columns contains the start line of ORD-2290 (extracted in SENS_LONG_VAL) where the long sensitivity value will begin.

columns.name: SENS_END_LN
columns.description: This column contains the end line of ORD-2290(extracted in SENS_LONG_VAL) where the long sensitivity value will terminate.

columns.name: SENS_COMM
columns.description: This column contains a short sensitivity note for ORD-2290 (extracted in SENS_LONG_VAL).

columns.name: SENS_COMM_START_LN
columns.description: This column contains the start line in ORD-2290(extracted in SENS_LONG_VAL) of a long sensitivity comment.

columns.name: SENS_COMM_END_LN
columns.description: This column contains the end line in ORD-2290(extracted in SENS_LONG_VAL) of a long sensitivity comment.

columns.name: SENSITIVITY_UNITS
columns.description: Indicates units applied for antibiotics on a sensitivity test.

columns.name: SENS_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description: Indicates the status of a sensitivity test.

columns.name: ANTIBIO_LNC_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the LOINC record indicating the Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the antibiotic associated with the sensitivity.

columns.name: METHOD_LNC_ID
columns.description: Microbiology method LOINC ID.

columns.name: SENS_REF_RANGE
columns.description: Indicates the reference range for antibiotics on a sensitivity test.

columns.name: HIDE_ANTIBIOTIC_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the antibiotic result is hidden from a user when viewed from within the patientï¿½s chart.

columns.name: SENS_UNIT_UOM_ID
columns.description: Pointer to the UOM (units of measure master file) record that represents the sensitivity's unit.

columns.name: SENS_UNIT_UOM_ID_UNIT_NAME
columns.description: Record name

columns.name: SENS_METHOD_ID
columns.description: This column stores a procedure record ID that represents a method of testing an organism's sensitivity to an antibiotic. The value in this item is used to distinguish sensitivities obtained by different testing methods.

columns.name: RESULTING_LAB_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the resulting agency which is responsible for an antibiotic sensitivity.

columns.name: RESULTING_LAB_ID_LLB_NAME
columns.description: Interface laboratory name.

columns.name: SENS_ACCR_STAT_YN
columns.description: This item determines the accreditation status of the corresponding antibiotic. If set to Y-Yes, the corresponding antibiotic is accredited. If set to N-No, the corresponding antibiotic is not accredited. If null, no evaluation was performed on the antibiotic to determine if it is accredited or not.
